text: The 2016–17 Liechtenstein Cup is the 72nd season of Liechtenstein's annual cup competition. Seven clubs competed with a total of 17 teams for one spot in the first qualifying round2017/18 Access list Bert Kassies' Site of the 2017–18 UEFA Europa League. FC Vaduz are the defending champions. ==Participating clubs== {| class="wikitable" |- valign="top" bgcolor="#99CCCC" | align="center" width="16%" | 2015–16 Super League (1st tier) | align="center" width="16%" | 2015–16 1. Liga (4th tier) | align="center" width="16%" | 2015–16 2. Liga (6th tier) | align="center" width="14%" | 2015–16 3. Liga (7th tier) | align="center" width="17%" | 2015–16 4. Liga (8th tier) | align="center" width="17%" | 2015–16 5. Liga (9th tier) |- valign="top" | *FC Vaduz TH | *FC Balzers *USV Eschen/Mauren | *FC Ruggell | *FC Balzers II *FC Schaan *FC Triesen | *FC Balzers III *USV Eschen/Mauren II *FC Ruggell II *FC Schaan II (Azzurri) *FC Triesen II *FC Triesenberg | *USV Eschen/Mauren III *FC Schaan III *FC Triesenberg II |} TH Title holders. ==First round== The first round involved the teams which did not reach the previous season's semifinals. FC Vaduz II (U23) did not enter the competition. Four of them received a bye to the Second round. |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|17 August 2016 |- |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|23 August 2016 |- |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|24 August 2016 |- |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|7 September 2016 |} ==Second round== The second round involved the four winners of the first round and the four teams which received a bye through to the second round (FC Balzers III, FC Ruggell, FC Triesen, and FC Triesenberg). |colspan="3" style="background- color:#99CCCC"|27 September 2016 |- |colspan="3" style="background- color:#99CCCC"|28 September 2016 |- |colspan="3" style="background- color:#99CCCC"|4 October 2016 |} ==Quarterfinals== The quarterfinals involved the four teams who won in the second round, as well as the semifinalists in the last season (FC Vaduz, USV Eschen/Mauren, FC Balzers II and FC Schaan). |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|25 October 2016 |- |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|26 October 2016 |} ==Semifinals== |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|5 April 2017 |- |colspan="3" style="background-color:#99CCCC"|11 April 2017 |} ==Final== ==References== ==External links== * Category:Liechtenstein Football Cup Cup Liechtenstein Cup
title: 2016–17 Liechtenstein Cup
